alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Deaf Smith; Donley; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 10 at 2:20PM CST until January 10 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE ENTIRE TEXAS AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES... * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham...Potter...Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong...Donley and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Today, southwest winds of 25 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph expected. For Wednesday, west 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * Relative Humidity...Today, as low as 12 percent expected. For Wednesday, as low as 11 percent possible. * Red Flag Threat Index...Today, RFTI values of 2 to 3 expected. For Wednesday, RFTI values of 3 to 6 possible. * Timing... From Noon to 6 PM today. From 11 AM to 8 PM CST on Wednesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
